Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The USGS leads U.S. mineral resource mapping and supply chain analysis for economic and national security, assessing global risks, domestic/defense needs, and future production. It partners with states, companies, universities, and agencies to find new resources in ground, mine tailings, and energy wastes. ACOLITE (v20221114.0) uses DSF algorithm to produce unitless aquatic reflectance: the ratio of water-leaving radiance to downwelling irradiance, multiplied by π.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
aws s3 ls --no-sign-request s3://usgs-wma-sentinel-2-aqr-acolite-dsf/version_01/   272.4 TiB

Aquatic reflectance produced with the dark spectrum fitting (DSF) algorithm as implemented in the Atmospheric Correction for OLI “lite” (ACOLITE) software (version 20221114.0). Aquatic reflectance is defined here as unitless water-leaving radiance reflectance and represents the ratio of water-leaving radiance (units of watts per square meter per steradian per nanometer) to downwelling irradiance (units of watts per square meter per nanometer) multiplied by pi.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: We will first download the data from AWS and store it on our hard drives. We use our in-house tools to pack CAR files. In the future, we will primarily deliver data to storage service providers via network transmission and by mailing hard drives.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Asia other than Greater China, North America, Greater China
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: HTTP or FTP server, Shipping hard drives
